titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Dr. Marvin Margoshes (b. 1925) graduated in 1950 from the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn with a B.S. in Chemistry. In 1953 he was awarded a Ph.D in Physical Chemistry from Iowa State College. He was Editor of Spectrochimica Acta B and served on the Editorial Advisory Board and the Instrumentation Advisory Board of Analytical Chemistry. He has been a member of the Society for Applied Spectroscopy since its inception in 1958.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of eight programs from symposia of the Eastern Analytical Symposium (EAS), from 1960 to 1968 (1965 is missing). EAS is sponsored by the American Chemical Society, the Society for Applied Spectroscopy, and the Metropolitan Microchemical Society. The EAS symposia provided a forum for presentation and discussion of topics of interest in the fields of analytical chemistry and applied spectroscopy. The programs list exhibitors and abstracts of papers given. One is annotated, presumably by Margoshes.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
